oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Grand Ole Opry - Prince Albert - 1957-11-16 - Part 1
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Part 1 of Prince Albert tobacco sponsored Grand Ole Opry segment from November 16, 1957. Featuring Grant Turner (announcer), Ernest Tubb (host/performer), guest performers the Everly Brothers, Jim Reeves, Marty Robbins, and Ray Price, and regular performers Rod Brasfield, Tommy Jackson, the Jordanaires, Chet Atkins, Minnie Pearl, and Stringbean. Held at Ryman Auditorium, Nashville, TN. It is announced that this is the 945th broadcast, the 32nd anniversary of the Opry, and that the 6th annual Disc Jockey Festival is taking place.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ernest Tubb; Rod Brasfield; Everly Brothers; Tommy Jackson; Jim Reeves; Jordanaires; Marty Robbins; Ray Price
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Grant Turner introduces Ernest Tubb -- Walking The Floor Over You (Ernest Tubb) -- Opening statement (Grant Turner, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Rod Brasfield -- Comedy routine (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces the Everly Brothers -- Bye Bye Love (Everly Brothers) -- Prince Albert commercial (Rod Brasfield, Ernest Tubb) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Tommy Jackson -- Katy Hill (Tommy Jackson fiddle) -- Ernest Tubb Jim Reeves -- Four Walls (Jim Reeves, Jordanaires) (excerpt) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Marty Robbins -- Singing The Blues (Marty Robbins) (excerpt) -- Ernest Tubb introduces Ray Price -- Crazy Arms (Ray Price) (excerpt)
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: WSM (Radio station : Nashville, Tenn.); National Broadcasting Company; Grand ole opry (Radio program); United States.
